statement: All core orchestration steps should be scheduled from mutations, not actions, to preserve atomic scheduling guarantees and avoid orphaned scheduled work.
rationale: Convex docs state scheduling from mutations is atomic; actions are not atomic and can schedule work even if the action fails.
keyAssumptions: We can move scheduling decisions into mutations without losing needed side effects
validationCriteria: No scheduled work exists without corresponding state changes
critiquePoints: Some scheduling requires external side effects available only in actions
questions: Which existing steps rely on actions today?
